title: I feel like I am dealing less and taking more damage than normal
body:
Lately I have been noticing that even on champions I am comfortable with I am dealing way too little damage and taking a lot of damage. I don't know if maybe I changed something about my builds or runes or masteries or something and don't remember or something.

Like one game I got fed as lucian and feel like I did maybe 20% of a squishy's health out of a full combo with passive autos between them, then I played against him and at like level 4 he was one shotting me with the same combo.

I never played against a graves, but I had a graves game where I was fed and had a similar issue. 

Those two games were on aram, but I don't see how that matters any. 

As malzahar I could have a W out, E them, and they could sit there and tank 4 of my voidlings and take maybe 25% hp if they didn't kill them and let it hit them the full duration.

Idk, I just feel like I am doing something way wrong lately. Thanks in advance for any help and sorry if I sound whiny or something.

replies.body:
I played another jinx game using my ad caster set, cant remember exactly what it had but I think it was armor pen marks and quints, but it felt more like I am used to. Maybe I was just using different pages than I was before since I came back?

Eh I will experiment some more, thanks for the help everyone.

Agreed.

When I play jinx I take 26% attack speed runes to start and build straight into damage

1.IE
2.Rannans or Phantom
 - I always take Phantom over rannans if there are hard hitting AD's in the game like : Draven, Yasuo, Darius
3. The other of [ 2 ]  if I dont get StaticShiv
4.EssenceReaver

This build alone will generally kill everything UNLESS they have majority tanks.

If they only have 1 or 2 tanks then finish with BlackCleaver.

in your specific example that happened most likely because you were lacking some game knowledge

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Graves

read his E passive

Also graves is currently a jungler sortof.. he doesn't have to be squishy and he is really good at regenerating health. 

More than likely you are noticing some changes to something and haven't adapted yet, you should link some games where you felt weird about your damage

> [{quoted}](name=CerealBoxOfDoom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=u42XRvJR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-10-11T02:07:36.409+0000)
>
> in your specific example that happened most likely because you were lacking some game knowledge
> 
> http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Graves
> 
> read his E passive
> 
> Also graves is currently a jungler sortof.. he doesn't have to be squishy and he is really good at regenerating health. 
> 
> More than likely you are noticing some changes to something and haven't adapted yet, you should link some games where you felt weird about your damage

Look at my history, literally all of them besides poppy. I am new to poppy and I don't see her played much so I don't have anything to compare her to.

And I know and knew what grave's E passive did, and all of his skills for that matter.

Edit: I forgot to mention, this holds true even for the matches that I won and had good scores in. I feel like I really only did like the last 20% of their health and with much difficulty.

Lol, did you just get back from a long break? 

xD one of your talon games in your match history has a brutalizer wtf?

> [{quoted}](name=CerealBoxOfDoom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=u42XRvJR,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-10-11T03:06:01.333+0000)
>
> Lol, did you just get back from a long break? 
> 
> xD one of your talon games in your match history has a brutalizer wtf?

Kinda, I have been playing for a couple months since I came back, and my break wasn't that long. The only Talon game in my history has a ghostblade, BF sword, two longswords, and mercury treads (I cant remember why I got the treads, but it was important).

youre talking about recent history maybe.. I can only see your ranked history on this particular non-laggy site lol. 

It would appear that you aren't great at farming. You seem to play jinx a lot. I wonder if you finish {{item:3031}}  or get {{item:1038}} {{item:3085}}  first because the latter is more popular and seems to help ppl out more on jinx, especially those that aren't getting a lot of gold. That's part of why a lot of jinx players do bad. They try to prioritize crits over attac speed and wave clear. 

As for everything else I suspect you're just not used to ppl getting tankier builds.

Hi.

You need to remember that just because you play against what are assumed squishies - doesnt mean they are in every match - even against the same players.

I have a few really good examples of this.

Every play against a Vigar that usually can 1 shot people because of his passive and ult?
 - Doesnt happen when you start 24 flat MR in lane against him and just continue to build MR
 - I did this as a lulu in ranked and my first item was banner of command

He had a really hard time because I would easily push him out of lane because he would exhaust all his mana trying to ruin me when I just could easily heal it back while taking very little damage

Same thing applies in bot lane
 - a squishy support could take flat armor 24 and take almost not damage from autos.

If you are having a problem in your matchup - maybe try lolnexus and see what runes your targets are carrying - you may need to adjust your build to compensate on your ADC such as MortalReminder/LordDominicsRegard

>  - Doesnt happen when you start 24 flat MR in lane against him and just continue to build MR
>  - I did this as a lulu in ranked and my first item was banner of command

> 
> If you are having a problem in your matchup - maybe try lolnexus and see what runes your targets are carrying - you may need to adjust your build to compensate on your ADC such as MortalReminder/LordDominicsRegard

I have been doing that and I haven't noticed any weird rune sets like that. Typical 9 armor seals (occasionally scaling or flat health) and 12 mr almost every game. Penetration or flat ad/ap marks and quints usually.

> [{quoted}](name=Zezockary,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=u42XRvJR,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-10-11T03:52:55.716+0000)
>
> I have been doing that and I haven't noticed any weird rune sets like that. Typical 9 armor seals (occasionally scaling or flat health) and 12 mr almost every game. Penetration or flat ad/ap marks and quints usually.


Then it has to be itemization.
